sentences.en: A feeling or an intuition of what is going to occur ; a presentiment.
sentences.cn: 他突然对即将到来的危险有了一种预感.

sentences.en: Already I have a presentiment that it won't.
sentences.cn: 我已有了一种预感,这不会延续多久的.

sentences.en: He had a presentiment of disaster.
Her presentiment was proved by the next happening things.
sentences.cn: 接下来发生的事,证实了她的预感.

sentences.en: I had a presentiment that he represented a danger to me.
sentences.cn: 我预感他会给我带来危险。

sentences.en: I had a presentiment that she would come soon.
sentences.cn: 你知道,我已经预感到,她很快就会来.

sentences.en: I have a presentiment that I am doomed to make way for Fanny Glover.
sentences.cn: 我有一种预感;我注定要给范妮·格洛弗让路.

sentences.en: I have a presentiment that something bad will happen.
sentences.cn: 我有某种不祥事要发生的预感.

sentences.en: It describes the basic way of antidumping evadable accounting and the presentiment foundation of index system.
sentences.cn: 阐述了反倾销规避会计的基本方法以及预警指标体系的设立,并提出反倾销规避会计在实行中所应注意的问题.

sentences.en: She often has an ominous presentiment.
sentences.cn: 她时时有一种不祥的预感.

sentences.en: Soapy followed the man with a presentiment that luck would again run against him.
sentences.cn: 索皮跟随着那人,却有预感幸运将再次与他背道而驰.

sentences.en: Without knowing why - it was presentiment, perhaps - Passepartout became vaguely uneasy.
sentences.cn: 路路通不知道为什么, 很可能是由于一种预感,使他觉得有点莫名其妙的担心.

trans.tran_en: a strange feeling that something is going to happen, especially something bad
